entries.meaning: (obsolete) A garland carried before the bier of a maiden and subsequently hung over the grave.
examples: Dr. Furnivall has lately seen in the aisle of Ashford Church, near Bakewell, in Derbyshire, five of the "virgin crantses," or "maidens' garlands," which the priests allowed Ophelia's corpse — with other rites — by "great command."
